dialogue.raw_text: Hi Meurice, this is Helene, Helene Trend, and I'm calling 'cause I wanna know just what the hell that remark you made about Sylvia's supposed to mean...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...She says you're full of shit and frankly I believe her. And hey, I love you too. Sure. Anyway, you better call me soon because I'm going to South America tonight--you know, Uruguay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (barking) Listen asshole, you know who this is. I just got back from Corpus and there's a lot of money missing from the safe...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...I'm not saying you took it but the place was your responsibility and I told you to keep an eye on your asshole friend. Don't--uh, don't come to the bar tonight, I've got a meeting. But tomorrow I want to have a word with you, and with Ray--if you can find him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Meurice, where the hell have you been? I--
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Pressing into a dark stain in the upholstery of the back seat of his car. When he raises it the fingertip is red--the seat still wet with blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: RAY Looking down at the seat. He backs out of the car and walks up the driveway to his house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he comes through the screen door. It bangs shut behind him. As he crosses the living room we see, and he hears, Meurice's Trans Am pulling up and stopping at the foot of the lawn. Ray turns and looks out the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: CLOSET DOOR Ray throws it open and hurriedly pulls out the first thing at hand--a sheet. We hear the door of the Trans Am open and slam shut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . RAY'S BUNGALOW TRACKING SHOT  ON RAY Exiting the house as the screen door bangs and shudders behind him. He hurries down the walk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meurice is rounding the bottom of the lawn and starting up the drive toward the incriminating car. Its back door is standing ajar.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I hope you're planning on leaving town.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Reacting to the line as he reaches the car. He bends over to throw the sheet over the seat just as Meurice walks up behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ray is still hunched in the open doorway. He freezes momentarily in arranging the sheet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ray doesn't reply or turn around. Meurice is getting more strident.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ray backs out of the car and turns around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ray looks evenly at Meurice. Behind him the sheet has been arranged over the seat. He puts an unlit cigarette in his mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meurice reaches out and swipes the unlit cigarette out of Ray's mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns and stares down the street, exasperated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mow that his temper is gone, he realizes he has nothing much to say. He shakes his head and turns back down the drive, muttering as he lights himself Ray's cigarette.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (his back to Meurice; arranging the sheet) Got a problem, Meurice?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, you do, cowboy. You been to the bar?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You shouldn't have taken the money...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...Look at me man, I'm serious. You broke in the bar and ripped off the safe...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...Abby warned me you were gonna make trouble. Trouble with you is, you're too fucking obvious; the only ones with the combination are me and you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...and Abby. Maybe. But as far as I'm concerned that only leaves one fucking possibility.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Those things are nothing but coffin nails.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...Look. Personally I don't give a shit. I know Marty's a hard-on but you gotta do something. I don't know; give the money back, say you're sorry, or get the fuck out of here, or something...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...It's very humiliating, preaching about this shit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: RAY Standing in front of the back door of his car, watching Meurice walk away. His right hand rises into frame to deposit another unlit cigarette in his mouth. Offscreen, Meurice calls from the end of the drive:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We hear his car door slam. After a moment Ray exits frame, heading for the house. The camera tracks slowly in to the back window of the car. Traces of blood are starting to seep up from the upholstery into the sheet.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not laughing at this, Ray Bob, so you know it's no fucking joke.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . MARTY'S HOUSE  DAY LOW WIDE SHOT  FRONT FOYER We are looking across the tiled floor toward the front doorway. The room has the dim gray cast of daytime inside a shuttered house. We hold on the empty foyer as we hear an intermittent high whining sound. We hear the padding of feet on carpet, and then the clatter of nails on tile as Opal, Marty's German shepherd, trots into frame and circles the foyer, still whining. She jumps up and scratches desperately at the front door. A slow, rhythmic pounding is very faint on the track.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MARTY'S BAR  DUSK Abby has just gotten out of her car and is walking up to the front of the darkened bar. The faint, rhythmic thumping continues over the cut, its source somewhere offscreen. As Abby takes a key out of her purse and lets herself into the bar, the thumping stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Abby switches on the lights, looks around, goes to the back- office door. Locked. As she fits her key into the lock:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The door swings open, fanning a shaft of light onto the darkened room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are looking from the inside at the bathroom door that won't close all the way. As the light fans into the office beyond and seeps in through the crack of the bathroom door, we see Visser's sleeve cuff and his hand pressing against the door, to hold it near-shut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Standing in the office doorway. We pull her into the room. She stops abruptly, looking past the camera, and wrinkles her nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marty's fish, now half-decayed, still lie on the desk. Some of the desk drawers stand open, with some of their contents strewn across the surface of the desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She takes a step forward. We hear the crunch of glass underfoot. She looks down at the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shards of broken glass lie on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks up from the floor toward the back door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The pane of the back-door window closest to the knob has been shattered from the outside, scattering broken glass into the office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She crosses slowly to the desk, staring at the rotted fish. She looks up from the desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the standing safe behind the desk lies a white towel. Abby's hand enters frame ans picks up the towel. In slow motion a hammer that's been wrapped inside slips out of the towel, falls end-over-end, hits the floor with a dull thud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stooping down to pick up the hammer. At eye level as she stoops down is the combination dial to the safe. The dial has been battered by the hammer. Abby looks from the hammer to the floor under the desk chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blood stains.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Staring down at the floor. She rises and looks at the desk. As she rises we hear glass under her feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dead fish. Beyond them, on the floor around the desk, broken glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Staring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dead fish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She seems to be falling slowly backwards. The camera falls with her, keeping her in close shot. Her head hits a pillow. We pull back slowly to reveal that she is lying on the bed in her apartment, staring across the room. She lies motionless on the bad, her eyes wide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Across the darkened apartment we see the curtainless windows, and beyond them, across the lamplit street, the facade of the opposite building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ABBY Lying still. After a moment she gets out of bed, crosses to the front door of the apartment, locks it, then walks unsteadily back to the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ABBY IN BED She opens her eyes, lies still for a moment, coughs. She gets out of bed and walks across the still dark apartment to the bathroom. She shuts the bathroom door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Abby looks at herself in the mirror above the sink, then turns on the tap water. From a neighboring apartment we hear a dull rhythmic thumping on the wall. She pauses, listens for a moment, then starts to splash water on her face. From somewhere offscreen we hear the sharp sound of glass shattering. It reverberates for a moment, then dies. Abby looks up at the bathroom door. We hear a scraping at the lock of her apartment door. Abby listens. Suddenly we hear the lock springing open, and the front door swinging on its hinges.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ABBY Startled. She shuts off the water and stands motionless. Droplets of water are streaming down her face. We hear the sound of footsteps in the next room, crunching across broken glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is no answer. After a moment we hear bedsprings creak in the next room. Abby opens the bathroom door and walks out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A shaft of light slices across the floor from the open bathroom door. Broken glass glints on the floor. In the semi- darkness we can see that someone is sitting on the bed. The person looks up. It is Marty. Abby recoils.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Abby looks nervously at Marty. Droplets of water are still running down her face. She brushes one from her eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He smiles thinly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Abby takes a step back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still smiling, Marty shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He stands. We hear glass under his feet. He unbuttons the middle button of his coat and reaches inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He withdraws something from an inside pocket and tosses it to her.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ...That's a stupid thing to say, right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. You're just saying that because you're scared...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ABBY'S HANDS As she catches the object. It is her compact.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ABBY She looks from her hands up to Marty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marty gags, leans forward, doubles over to vomit--blood. The blood washes over the floor at his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bolts upright in bead with a muffled groan. Sweat pours down her face. She brushes a drop of sweat from her eye and looks around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Moonlight glints through the windows across the hardwood floor. Through the windows we can see the facade of the opposite building. The apartment is dark and still, just as we left it before she fell asleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She slumps back onto the bed. One hand gropes down out of frame and comes up holding an illuminated alarm clock. She looks at it, drops it back to the floor. She turns on her side and stares across the room toward the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PRE-DAWN It is still not quite light. The few lights that shined in the windows of the opposite building before are now off; the facade of the building is a flat, undetailed gray.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ABBY Still lying on her side on the bed, her eyes open, staring at the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: WINDOW After a moment Abby enters frame. She picks her coat off a chair and puts it on. We hear a car door slam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Abby has just gotten out of her car in the foreground and is crossing the lawn to the house. Down the road the street lights are still on. One light burns in the house, in the window of Ray's bedroom. Abby approaches it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Over Abby's shoulder, as she leans against the sill of the open window and looks inside. Ray sits on the bed in the empty room, smoking a cigarette, his profile to the window, gazing fixedly at the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ray starts and looks toward the window, squinting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . RAY'S BUNGALOW WIDE SHOT  LIVING ROOM Abby is coming through the screen door. The room is strikingly bare of everything except furniture. All personal effects have been removed. Abby looks around, bewildered, as Ray enters from the hallway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Abby, still standing in front of the door, looks at him uncomprehendingly. Ray walks over to a couple of cardboard boxes stacked in the corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He ties a knot around the top carton with a piece of cord, then cuts the cord with a collapsible fishing knife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She slowly shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He leans back against the boxes, watching her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ray shakes his head, smiling. Abby squints at him, looking for help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He puts the knife in his pocket and walks over to the door. As he approaches her:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ray faces Abby in front of the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's difficult to bring out. Ray's hand gropes for the cross- slat on the screen door. Finally:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Abby stares. An object materializes in the sky beyond them. It is flipping end-over-end in slow motion, moving toward Abby and Ray and the screen door. Abby and Ray, each staring at the other, fail to notice until-- THWACK--it bounces off the screen. Abby starts; Ray doesn't. The spell is broken, Abby pushes hesitantly at the screen door. Ray's hand slides off the cross-slat; he makes no move to stop her.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ...But first I gotta know what happened.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you want to know?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You broke into the bar. You wanted to get your money. You and Marty had a fight. Something happened...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...I don't know, wasn't it you? Maybe a burglar broke in, and you found--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...Nobody broke in, Abby. I'll tell you the truth...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...Truth is, I've felt sick the last couple of days. Can't eat... Can't sleep... When I try to I... Abby...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...The truth is... he was alive when I buried him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: THE FRONT STOOP As Abby steps over the rolled-up newspaper that hit the screen door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hurrying down the driveway to get to her car. A low rumble is building on the soundtrack. Abby glances at Ray's car as she passes it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: TRACKING FORWARD  THE CAR More blood has seeped into and dried on the dropsheet covering the back seat. The bass rumble grows louder, punctuated by a rhythmic thumping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As she pounds frantically on the door--the sound continuing over the cut. After a moment the door edges open. Meurice is standing in the doorway in a long bathrobe. A sleeper's blindfold is pushed up over his forehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks at her hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He steps aside to let her pass.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ... I'm sorry, Meurice. I gotta talk to you... Can I come in?

direction.raw_text: As Abby enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meurice switches on a table lamp; the curtains are drawn against the sun. Abby follows Meurice over to the bar.
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He glares at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He grimaces.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her head meets an end cushion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meurice rises from the sofa, sighs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He leans down to the table next to the sofa.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Jesus, I got a hangover. Want a drink?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I-- MEURICE Well I do...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...For you I answer the door. If you wanna stay here, that's fine. But I'm retired.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Something happened with Marty and Ray--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...Ray stole a shitload of money from Marty. Until both of 'em calm down I'm not getting involved.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No Meurice, it's worse than that. Something really happened, I think Marty's dead--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?! Did Ray tell you that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's total bullshit. Marty called me after he was jacked up...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...I mean, I don't know where he is, but he ain't dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You don't look too good. You sleep last night?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right. Just sit tight. Try to get some sleep...

dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ABBY Her head on the cushion. We hear engine rumble. Abby twists her head back, following Meurice. As we hear the table lamp being switched off we:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HIGHWAY  NIGHT POV FROM A CAR The engine rumble continues over the cut. There is no other traffic on the highway. A light fog covers the road. A green highway sign says: "San Antonio 73 mi." We hear a car radio playing softly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: RAY Driving. He is gently lit by the light from the dashboard. He reaches forward to turn off the radio. The only sound now is the hum of the engine and the rhythmic clomping of tires on pavement. The look and sound of the scene are close to those of the first scene of the movie. Ray takes a cigarette out of his pocket and puts it in his mouth, but leaves it unlit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The headlights of an approaching car materialize in the fog. The car passes with a roar. Up ahead a traffic light is turning amber.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The engine hum drops as he slows. We hear the low engine rumble and the squeaking brakes of another car. Ray is now stopped in front of the deserted intersection. He looks up in his rearview mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another car is stopped just behind him, the fog floating up past its headlights. The headlights halate in the fog; none of the rest of the car is visible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The unlit cigarette still in his mouth. He looks down from the rearview mirror to the intersection ahead of him. There is a long pause, during which we hear only the steady purr of Ray's car and the knocking rumble of the car behind him. Ray looks up at the traffic light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The light is just turning from red to green.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: RAY'S FOOT ON BRAKE He takes his foot off the brake, hesitates for a moment, the replaces it on the brake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: RAY He looks up in his rearview mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The headlights of the other car remain motionless behind him. The car makes no move to pass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He slowly takes the cigarette from his mouth and drops it onto the seat next to him. His eyes shift from the rearview mirror to the traffic light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Green fog floats past the green light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His face frozen. He turns slowly to look behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The other car is still motionless. We hear the muted rumble of its engine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His eyes shift back to the mirror. He gropes for his window handle and slowly rolls it down. He sticks out his left arm, eyes still on the rearview mirror, and waves for the other car to go around him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The other car remains still for a moment. White fog floats up beyond the red fog created by Ray's brake lights. Finally the car pulls out slowly to the left to pass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watching the car pass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the car pulls out into the light from the intersection and Ray's headlights, we see that it is a battered green Volkswagon. First the car itself, and then its red tail lights, disappear into the fog.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watching, for a long moment. Finally he takes his foot off the brake, turns the steering wheel hard left and hangs a U-turn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A light is switched on in the expensively appointed room. Meurice enters, walking silently on the carpet, looking around the room. He throws the light off at the far end and leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The door swings open.  Meurice throws the switch near the door and the room is bathed in light. We are once again in the bedroom where we earlier saw Abby looking through her purses. We start to hear the faint buzzing of a fly. Meurice glances around, throws off the light, and shuts the door. Black.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somewhere offscreen a light is switched on and we are looking in close shot at the dead fish. The sound of the fly is louder with the cut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: RAY Standing in the doorway from the bar, staring down at the fish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: THE OFFICE Ray glances around at the broken glass lying on the floor. His gaze shifts to the safe and the hammer in front of it. He walks over to the safe and stoops down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: RAY AT SAFE He works its battered dial and it swings open. He shuffles through the contents and brings out a small pile of photographs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he flips through the photographs. The first four are Ray and Abby in the motel room bed. The last is a mounted 8 x 10: Abby and Marty on a Gulf beach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PICTURE DETAIL Marty is still laughing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He scowls at the shots Visser took, then puts them back in the safe. When his hand comes out he is holding another photograph--this one folded twice. He unfolds it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His and Abby's corpses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he straightens slowly from the safe in the background. At desk level, we again see the glint of Visser's lighter under the dead fish. Ray crosses slowly around the desk into the foreground and lays the picture flat on the desktop. For a moment he stares down at it, then wheels abruptly and leaves frame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ray and Abby are once again clearly visible. Ray is starting across the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Abby takes a fearful step back as Ray strides toward the light switch, next to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This brings Ray up short. He stares at Abby. It registers that it is him she's afraid of.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Abby takes another step back. Her voice comes out, after a pause, half-strangled:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ray winces. He slowly shakes his head with a pained half- smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We hear the dull report of a rifle and the deafening sound of shattering glass. The gun shot hits Ray in the back, knocking him to the floor. He lies still.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (abruptly) --If you do anything the neighbors'll hear.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...Abby. I meant it... when I called...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ABBY She stares dumbly down at Ray. She looks slowly up to the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It has a gaping black hole. The sound of shattering glass still reverberates in the apartment. Small shards of glass chink down from the window and shatter on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Staring at the window, paralyzed--almost in a trance. Quiet except for the chinking of glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are looking through the telescopic sight of a high-powered rifle. The rifle sweeps up from Ray's body across the brightly lit room, and centers Abby, still staring at the window, in the cross hairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are looking past Abby toward the shattered window at the far end of the room. A brass lamp stands in the foreground, between Abby and the camera. Abby still stands paralyzed. Glass has stopped chinking from the window to the floor; there is a painful silence. Suddenly Abby dives to the floor just as CRASH the rest of the window falls away and PING the brass lamp somersaults toward us from the impact of the bullet. The window is now completely gone--just a black hole in the brightly lit wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scrambles into a corner at the window end of the room. The only sound is her heavy breathing. She looks over at Ray, then up at the bulb on the ceiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: CEILING BULB BACK TO ABBY Breathing heavily, almost hysterical. She looks down at the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ray is sprawled on the floor in a pool of blood and broken glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She reaches down and pulls off one of her shoes. She throws it at the ceiling bulb. We hear the bulb shatter and the room goes black. Abby rises and makes her way cautiously across the glass- littered floor toward Ray. She stoops over him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: THE DARK APARTMENT Its front door in background. Abby rises into frame and backs toward the doorway, staring down at the floor. One of her hands is covered with blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She winces and almost loses her balance as we hear a piece of glass crunching under her bare floor. She turns and moves to the front door, favoring one foot, and throws the door open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Abby lurches from her apartment and pounds on the neighboring door. No answer. She pounds on the door across the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Abby heads for the stairway at the far end of the hall. The heel of her shod foot is throwing her weight onto her bad foot; she kicks off the shoe.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (frightened, in Spanish) Get away! I'll call my son-in-law!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (groping for the words, in Spanish) No no--you don't understand--
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ABBY As she reaches the top of the stairs. She takes one step down, then brings herself up short. She looks over the railing down the stairwell. It is quiet. An innocent-sounding cough echoes somewhere in the building. We hear the sound of footsteps from somewhere below. Abby turns and hobbles back to her apartment. The bareness of the hallway sets off her abandoned shoe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As she enters and slams the door behind her. She scrabbles at the lock, finally manages to get it shut, then turns and looks frantically around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ray is lying still in the darkness. We can hear footsteps approaching up the hallway. Abby enters frame and kneels down next to Ray. She fumbles around him briefly in the darkness. The doorknob rattles. Abby freezes, listening, trying to control her breath. After a moment we hear a scraping at the lock. Abby moves to the bathroom adjoining the main room and shuts the door behind her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is very small. Abby presses her palms against the door and slowly eases her ear against the door to listen. The scraping in the apartment door lock continues. Sweat streams down Abby's face. She brushes a drop from her eye. We hear the snap of the lock springing open, and the front door swinging on its hinges.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R ON ABBY Her ear pressed to the door. From the next room we hear the sound of footsteps crunching across broken glass. Abby backs away from the door, stares at it, then turns and moves to the bathroom window. She looks out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A sheer drop to the narrow backyard of the building four stories below. Next to Abby's window is another window, separated from hers only by the breadth of the wall, that separates the two apartments.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Visser hunches, hands on knees, over Ray, who lies on the floor out of frame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hunkers down closer to Ray.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is rummaging through Ray's pockets but comes up empty- handed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Visser looks down at Ray, glances around the room, looks back down at Ray.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His hand, gripping something, flashes down out of frame. We hear a dull crunch.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ...You got some of my personal property.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...I don't know what the hell you two thought you were gonna pull.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Abby has drawn her head back from the bathroom window. She moves back to the door and braces herself against it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Visser straightens up from Ray's body. He drops something to the floor, out of frame, that lands with a thud. He goes over to the light switch on the wall and flips it back and forth. No light. He goes over to the brass lamp, sets it upright, tries its switch. Again nothing. He disappears into the kitchenette as we hold on its open doorway. After a moment we hear a refrigerator hum as a cold blue light plays in the doorway. There is the rattle of a can being pulled off the refrigerator rack, and the snap of its pull-tab being opened. After a couple of audible slurps we hear the can go back on the rack and, as the blue light disappears, we hear the refrigerator door close. Visser reappears in the doorway. He surveys the room, fixes on the bathroom door, goes over, turns the knob. The door swings open. He walks in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Visser looks around the cramped space. The shower curtain is drawn. He casually draws it back. The shower is empty. He goes to the window and leans out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sheer drop below; the other window to one side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He draws his head back in, presses his palms against the adjacent wall, and eases his ear to the wall to listen. Perfect quiet. After a moment he goes back to the window, braces himself against the sash, and sticks his arm out--groping for the window of the adjacent apartment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ABBY'S BUILDING / BATHROOM WINDOW CLOSE SHOT  VISSER'S FACE Pressing against the glass as he leans against the upper half of the bathroom window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: VISSER'S HAND It finds the adjacent window and starts to raise it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Again we see him through the window. His jaw is set as he gropes offscreen. Suddenly his body jerks violently forward, his head smacking against the glass and cracking it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ADJACENT APARTMENT CLOSE SHOT  VISSER'S HAND Abby (out of frame) has grabbed it and now THUMP she slams the window down on his wrist, catching it between the window sash and sill. Her other hand flashes across frame to THUNK pin Visser's hand to the sill with Ray's knife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We hear the shatter of glass as the shock causes his head to break through the window. His hand is nailed into the apartment next door. He is in pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Abby back slowly from the window, staring at the hand. From the ground below we hear the faint and echoing sounds of the shards of glass shattering against pavement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: THE WINDOW Visser's pinned hand is writhing. As we hear a muffled CRACK, a circle of light opens with a puff of plaster dust in the wall that separates the two apartments. A line of light shoots across the dark apartment from the bright bathroom next door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Staring at the wall. We hear a second CRACK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A second hole has opened in the wall, letting through a second shaft of light. Four more sharp reports in rapid succession: With each gun blast a bright circle opens and a new shaft of light penetrates the dark apartment. Finally we hear the CLICK of an empty chamber, and the clatter of the empty gun being dropped to the floor of the bathroom next door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ABBY Staring at the lines of light that crisscross the apartment. There is a long moment of silence, then a sudden THUMP.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: THE WALL Six circles of light. The circles go black momentarily as there is another THUMP. And another. Each time Visser pounds his fist against the wall, there is a muffled THUMP and his swinging arm strobes the bullet holes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turns and hobbles toward the door of apartment. The muffled thumping continues, as in her dream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Abby emerges from the adjacent apartment. She stops and looks down the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The stairway is at the far end of the hall. The door of her own darkened apartment stands slightly ajar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: THE WALL The bullet holes strobing. The pounding, more purposeful now, grows louder and more intense. Finally, with a crash, Visser's fist penetrates the wall in an explosion of light and dust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We pull Abby as she limps hesitantly down the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: VISSER'S HAND Waving aimlessly through the ambient dust. He is blindly groping for the sill--and the knife that pins his other hand. His outstretched middle finger just grazes the handle of the knife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pulling Abby as she draws even with the door of her apartment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her pearl-handled revolver sits on the shelf just inside the door, where Ray left it. It catches the light from the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: VISSER'S FINGERTIPS The side of his middle finger rubs against the knife handle; the tip of his index finger barely touches it. Visser's fingers are trembling, indicating that his arm is stretched to its uttermost. A surge against the wall gives his fingers another inch or so and they curl around the handle of the knife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ABBY As she steps in from the hallway to pick up the gun. She looks around the apartment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The window of the apartment, its glass now completely gone, lets in streetlight. Ray's corpse is a dark form in the middle of the floor. A bright shaft of light slices across the room from offscreen. It glints on the shards of glass that litter the floor, just as in Abby's dream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: VISSER As he slowly, quietly draws his hand in from the hole in the wall. He is holding the knife. He turns slowly to face the door, listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ABBY She steadies herself against the wall and turns to look toward the bathroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bathroom door stands slightly ajar. The interior of the bathroom is a bright band in the shadowy recesses of the back of the apartment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: VISSER Moving quietly toward the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ABBY Staring, almost transfixed, at the bathroom door. She raises the gun, trembling, and trains it on the band of light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Visser's shadow falls across the crack in the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She shifts the gun slightly and fires.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With the roar of the gun, a small circle of light opens in the door. As the door waffles under the impact, we hear Visser collapsing behind it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leaning against the facing wall. She lowers the gun. She slides down the wall to finally rest seated on the floor. She brushes a drop of sweat from her eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cracked bathroom door spilling light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A pause. After a moment, her voice comes out half-choked:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bathroom door. Quiet for a long moment. Then, from inside the bathroom, we hear laughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Staring at the door. We hear the laughter subside, to leave the sound of labored breathing. Finally:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Visser lies on his back, his head underneath the bathroom sink. His good hand is pressed against his belly, which rises and falls with his heavy breathing. Blood seeps out between his fingers. He is smiling.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ...If I see him, I'll sure give him the message.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The underside of the sink, its convoluted chrome works beading moisture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looking, with mild interest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A condensed droplet trickles down the chrome. Directly overhead, it hangs for a moment from the lowest joint of the pipe. It fattens, wavers, wavers--and falls, spelling...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . [DELETED SCENE FROM 1st. DRAFT]
direction.name: direction
